intro: Helwingia himalaica var. nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan Himalayan helwingia, is a rare and ornamental shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous inflorescences and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments at high altitudes, often in forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. Due to its limited distribution and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
